item.title: Hyundai to unleash new model onslaught
item.subtitle: Hyundai to drastically overhaul its range in the next 18 months
item.description: Hyundai will launch 18 all-new or updated models in the next 18 months as part of a product “onslaught” that will include a new hot hatch and several other performance models.

image.title: The i30 sedan is due later this year replacing the Sonata.

item.title: BMW’s bonkers new performance SUV
item.subtitle: BMW X5 M review: Beefy performance SUV is seriously quick
item.description: BMW’s X5 M Competition is faster than any SUV needs to be.

image.title: Despite its speed the X5 M isn’t suited to track days.

item.title: ‘Worth the wait’: Cyberpunk 2077 reviewed
item.subtitle: Cyberpunk 2077 preview: First impressions, gameplay, new trailer
item.description: It may have just been delayed again but trust me Cyberpunk 2077 will be worth the wait. Especially after the recent announcement that the game will be backwards compatible with both next-gen consoles on day one!

image.title: Cyberpunk feels like it draws on the best features of some of the best games of the generation.

item.title: Lightning strikes kill more than 100 people in East India
item.subtitle: Lightning strikes kill 104 in India’s east
item.description: At least 104 people have been killed by lightning strikes as heavy monsoon storms swept India’s eastern and northern states of Bihar and Uttar Pradesh, officials say.

image.title: Lightning strikes during the June-September annual monsoon are fairly common in India. Picture: Twitter/@ESuJua2C777I3Ib

item.title: Lamborghini smashed minutes after being bought
item.subtitle: Lamborghini Huracan Performante Spyder smashed minutes after purchase in UK | Photos
item.description: A brand new luxury sports car has been smashed to pieces on a motorway just minutes after it was bought and taken for its very first drive.

image.title: A van crashed into the vehicle after it stopped on a motorway.

item.title: Google to pay for some Aussie news
item.subtitle: Google reveals plans to ‘finally’ pay for news it uses, but not all Australian media make its list
item.description: Facing worldwide pressure to pay for news it uses, Google has announced plans to compensate some publishers for using their content, including a small number of Australian outlets.

image.title: Google has previously fought efforts to make it pay for news it uses on its sites. Picture: AFP

item.title: Mercedes-Benz GLB review: Baby SUV is packed with fresh tech
item.subtitle: Mercedes-Benz GLB review: Baby SUV is packed with fresh tech
item.description: Mercedes-Benz offers more SUVs than any other brand.

image.title: The thrid row is best used for part time seating.

item.title: Map shows how Australia’s flagship environmental law is failing
item.subtitle: Map shows greater glider habitat under threat due to failing conservation law
item.description: The listing of Australian marsupial, the greater glider, as vulnerable under the Environment Protection and Biodiversity Conservation (EPBC) Act four years ago should’ve protected the species.

image.title: This young greater glider was displaced by clearing on the Darling Downs, Queensland. Picture: Briano / WWF-Australia

item.title: Shock results as Tesla finishes last in car quality survey
item.subtitle: Shock results as Tesla finishes last in car quality survey
item.description: Tesla has finished at the tail-end of an influential survey for new car quality.

image.title: Tesla’s Model 3 is one of the most advanced cars on sale.

item.title: Queensland drops to negative temperature
item.subtitle: Weather Australia: Parts of Queensland dropped to negative temperatures this morning
item.description: Spare a kind thought for Queenslanders who have today woken up to one of their coldest mornings in years.

image.title: Queensland woke up to freezing temperatures today. Source: Channel 9

item.title: Video of fisherman manhandling shark is not what it seems
item.subtitle: Video of fisherman ‘manhandling’ shark is not what it seems
item.description: A viral video appearing to show a fisherman wrestling with a shark just metres from a busy shoreline has turned out to show something quite different.

image.title: It looked like he was wrestling with the shark. Picture: Rachael Foster

item.title: Game changing tech for new BMWs
item.subtitle: Game changing tech for new BMWs
item.description: BMWs are getting big ticket tech upgrades.

image.title: Apple’s CarKey works in the same way as Apple Pay.

item.title: Incredible drone footage catches a great white shark circling surfers
item.subtitle: South Africa shark sighting: Drone spots great white stalking surfers | Video
item.description: Incredible drone footage caught unsuspecting surfers waiting to catch a wave as a man-eating great white shark swam right below them.

image.title: The kayaker appears to put themselves in danger so the surfers can paddle away. Picture: Zachary Berman/YouTube.

item.title: Hidden cost of COVID-19 revealed
item.subtitle: Hidden cost of COVID-19 revealed
item.description: Aussie workers are getting stung as they head back to the office.

image.title: Sydney trains is instructing passengers to follow strict social distancing measures.

item.title: Donald Trump’s ‘abusive’ tweet slapped with another warning label
item.subtitle: Donald Trump’s ‘abusive’ tweet slapped with another warning label
item.description: Another tweet from US President Donald Trump has been slapped with a warning label, after Twitter said it violated its policy against threatening harm.

image.title: It’s the fourth time Twitter has taken action against US President Donald Trump recently. Picture: Evan Vucci/AP

item.title: North Korea erects giant speakers to blast propaganda at the South
item.subtitle: North Korea erects giant loudspeakers on South Korea border
item.description: North Korea is set to reintroduce one of its most bizarre and annoying weapons against South Korea, as tensions between the two nations deteriorate further.

image.title: A North Korean loudspeaker in the border county of Kaepoong is seen from a South Korean observation post. Picture: YONHAP / AFP.

item.title: China and India agree to ‘cool’ tensions over deadly border clash
item.subtitle: India-China border conflict: Authorities agree to ‘cool’ tensions after deadly Himalayan clash
item.description: China and India have agreed to reduce tensions a week after their deadliest clashes in over 50 years on the disputed Himalayan border left 20 Indian troops dead in brutal hand-to-hand fighting.

image.title: Indian soldiers walk at the foothills of a mountain range near Leh, the joint capital of the union territory of Ladakh. Picture: Tauseef Mustafa/AFP

item.title: Tested: VW’s old-school ute
item.subtitle: Volkswagen Amarok V6 Core review: Stripped down workhorse misses key safety gear
item.description: The latest Volkswagen Amarok V6 is a throwback to simpler times. Stripped of luxuries, it combines a big motor with sound mechanical elements and a no-fuss interior.

image.title: The V6 Core is a stripped down version of VW’s workhorse ute.

item.title: Crash Bandicoot 4: It’s About Time officially revealed
item.subtitle: Crash Bandicoot 4: It’s About Time release date, trailer, screenshots revealed
item.description: After more than a decade, Crash Bandicoot is back in a brand new adventure.

image.title: It’s About Time features a new art style. Picture: Supplied

item.title: Discovery buried under Stonehenge astounds archaeologists
item.subtitle: Stonehenge: 4000-year-old 2km circle discovered
item.description: Archaeologists have found a major prehistoric monument under the earth near Stonehenge.

image.title: Stonehenge is one of the most visited places in England. Picture: Adrian Dennis/AFP

item.title: Perth surfer’s incredible clash with a sea lion
item.subtitle: Photographer captures Perth surfer’s clash with a sea lion at North Beach
item.description: A sea lion has given a surfer a helping hand in these hilarious pictures.

image.title: Perth photographer Nick Thake. Picture: Caters News Agency

item.title: 300 motorists a day fined for using phones
item.subtitle: Hidden cameras rake in $15 million in fines for drivers using phones
item.description: It seems Sydney motorists aren’t getting the message.

image.title: Hundreds of people a day are being caught by mobile phone cameras.

item.title: Aussie muscle car to sell for huge sum
item.subtitle: A piece of Holden motorsport history to sell for crazy price
item.description: Aussies have a chance to own a piece of local motorsport history, but there is a catch.

image.title: This Holden HT Monaro was the first factory built race car to wear a Holden badge.

item.title: Apple’s exciting new Watch feature
item.subtitle: Apple WWDC: WatchOS 7 unveiled with long awaited sleep tracking feature
item.description: Apple has announced a sleep-tracking feature for its trademark watch that helps users to make recommendations about waking up and when to go to sleep.

image.title: Apple CEO Tim Cook. Picture: Brooks Kraft/Apple Inc. via AP

item.title: Apple to make own ARM-based processors for Mac computers
item.subtitle: WWDC: Apple to make own ARM-based processors for Mac computers
item.description: Apple has announced major changes to its Mac computers, including a brand new Apple chip.

image.title: Apple has announced major changes to its line of Mac computers, including a brand new Apple chip.

item.title: Zoo investigates mystery giraffe death
item.subtitle: Gigi the giraffe dies two weeks after arriving at Sydney Zoo, prompting investigation
item.description: The unexpected death of Gigi the giraffe two weeks after she arrived at Sydney Zoo has prompted an investigation.

image.title: Sydney Zoo shared the sad news of Gigi’s death on their Facebook page. Picture: Sydney Zoo

item.title: iPhone users roasted over iOS 14 announcements
item.subtitle: Apple WWDC: Android users roast Tim Cook over iOS 14 updates
item.description: Apple and iPhone users are copping a roasting online over the newly announced iOS 14 system, with their Android counterparts saying it all sounds a little too familiar to them.

image.title: iPhone users are copping a roasting online over the new iOS 14 update. Picture: Brooks Kraft/Apple Inc. via AP
